newsitem.title: GREECE: ATHLETICS-QUIROT RETAINS WORLD 800 METRES TITLE.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-QUIROT RETAINS WORLD 800 METRES TITLE.

text.p: Ana Fidelia Quirot, who almost lost her life in a house fire four years ago, retained the world women's 800 metres title on Saturday.
The 34-year-old Cuban, second at the Atlanta Olympics last year, kept a close watch on her closest rival, Mozambique's former world champion Maria Mutola, during the opening lap.
Quirot moved up to Mutola's shoulder shortly before the bell, then sprinted to the front in the final 50 metres to win in one minute 57.14.
Mutola, the 1993 champion, gave up when she saw Quirot was going to take the gold and finished third behind Russian Yelena Afanasyeva.
Afanasyeva clocked 1:57,56 while Mutola finished in 1:57.59.
